examples.text: The bouncer is <w>carding</w> everyone at the door to check their age.
She sat by the fire, <w>carding</w> the wool to prepare it for spinning.

senses.sense_definition: The fraudulent trafficking or unauthorized use of credit card details.

examples.text: He was arrested for <w>carding</w> after purchasing electronics with stolen numbers.
Cybersecurity experts are tracking a new forum dedicated to illegal <w>carding</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A police practice where an officer stops, questions, and documents information from a person to gather intelligence, when no crime or suspicion of crime has been committed.

examples.text: Community leaders protested against <w>carding</w>, arguing it unfairly targets minority groups.
The new legislation aims to ban random <w>carding</w> by law enforcement officers.

senses.sense_definition: A piece of wool rolled by a carding machine.

examples.text: The spinner carefully collected the soft <w>carding</w> from the machine.
She twisted the <w>carding</w> into a fine thread using the spinning wheel.
